Reviews.Title: “Best Best Western”
Reviews.Author: SF_Junketeer
Reviews.Content: I was not able to get this through Priceline even when I bid up to 150 per night. There were lots of things going on in Napa this weekend (bike rides, half marathon runs, carneros festival etc.) so this hotel at $210 per night is very expensive for a Best Western but it is definitely the best Best Western we have stayed at. Pluses: large modern rooms, Microwave, Refrigerator, safe, good bath products, modern fitness room, heated pool, free WIFI, flat screen TV, good breakfast (eg mcmuffin, waffle, selection of fruits, yogurt, boiled eggs, cereal, bread selection), great customer service, great location, Negative: (altjough not really)..If you go to breakfast around 9:30, there are not enough tables available....although, this could be because this is a very busy weekend. There is a great, very reasonably priced, Japanese restaurant (Sushi Haku) 2 miles from the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay with a central location in Napa.”
Reviews.Author: anntamura5
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The bed was very nice and I loved the nice toiletries. You can hear the occasional people in the hall, doors shutting, and a little shower noise. But, it was very tolerable and normal. The hotel is conveniently located just off of Hwy 29. We enjoyed the location because it was between downtown Napa and St. Helena. The front desk staff was very pleasant and professional. Great wireless internet service, TV, fridge, and safe. The breakfast is mediocre but provides something before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly wonderful and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mloleary
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest, hippest Best Western I've ever stayed in. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. They've got a wine key behind the desk to open whatever bottles you've just purchased - and they know the area well. The room was clean and well-appointed and the beds very comfortable. Loved the nice toiletries! You're also ten paces from a great Mexican restaurant and a small grocery store, in case you want snacks with your wine. We enjoyed the hot tub and complimentary breakfast the next morning, too. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected but delightful”
Reviews.Author: Vforvan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Napa staying at the (dare I say) chic Best Western Premier Ivy. Front Desk staff was completely helpful where our check-in experience was a breeze. They even made some excellent dining recommendations that were within a 2 mile radius. The room was clean and nicely decorated in a 60s Madmen style; the King-sized bed was very comfortable. Also included with the room amenities were wireless Internet, fridge and microwave . Complimentary breakfast buffet was a highlight especially after taking a wine shuttle the day before. Will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: KerrieFin
Reviews.Content: Resd all the reviews and got a very nice price through a 3rd party vendor. Love the decoration scheme- very modern and whimsical at the same time. The duvet was a light cream color and had stains all over it- may want to rethink that color plan. The rest of the room was very clean and nicely appointed with two chairs and a table, desk and chair, and nice flat screen. Bathroom had great water pressure and a nice rain shower shower head. Loved the bath products as well! Breakfast was average continental- it was fine. The front desk person was pleasant each time I encountered him. My only complaints were that the bed was springy and uncomfortable, the hallway noise was quite loud (but putting a towel in the gap in the door and running a white noise machine or fan helps), and they would not let me extend my stay got one might at the same rate. I get that I got an excellent deal though an online service, but the hotel was no where near capacity- you would think they would want some money rather than none! Anyway, great location for wine touring. I would likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location at great price!”
Reviews.Author: Spicy04
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good reviews- we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel (Thur-Sun). Clean, newly remodeled room, good breakfast, convenient to downtown Napa and wineries - if you have a car (which we did). I would recommend calling ahead if you want a specific type of room and did not book directly with the note. We booked with Priceline (which, we learned, defaults to a double room) and there were no king rooms available when we arrived. The front desk did accommodate us with a second floor, pool view, though. Beds and pillows are on the firm side - but not unbearable. It got a little bit crowded at breakfast - but there was a nice patio for overflow seating...if you don't mind the traffic noise. The front desk will assist with getting the wine shipped home if you do not want to carry it home with you. The Red Hen -next door- is fun and has yummy margarita/rocks. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyhand
Reviews.Content: Clean room, comfy bed, nice bathroom. They had a great free continental breakfast buffet (waffles made from batter, sausage, fruits, cereals. The room had a mini fridge and microwave oven too. I would stay here again. Your less than 10 minutes to downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Best Napa deal ever”
Reviews.Author: AJeanA
Reviews.Content: Our friends invited us to Yountville for the weekend, but we could not justify the expense. As we looked on Trip Advisor, we realized that this location was 5 miles down the road and looked totally cute. We booked one night, and we would absolutely come back. Highlights for us: No 2 night minimum Heated swimming pool- it was like a giant bath tub. So much fun! It was such a treat to be swimming outside! Totally updated and modern decor. It kind of had an Alice in Wonderland, whimsical feel to it, that we appreciated. Great, friendly staff Super comfy bed and great linens Rain forest shower head Perfect location Affordable Thank you, Trip Advisor. So glad we found out about this great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel had it all”
Reviews.Author: nelsonm
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great location. Great pool/hot tub...shower was a rain shower. Rooms were clean, big...had cable. Free breakfast and parking. Really enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff But Horrible Beds. Not Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: IFLYMAUI
Reviews.Content: This is a motel. Know that first. It is at best a 2 1/2 to 3 star property. The staff was fantastic. The complimentary breakfast was much better than a continental breakfast with eggs, pastries, yogurt and oatmeal. The pool was nice and set back well from Hwy-29 and most of all, based on Napa standards, it was a bargain. It was the worst bed ever! The worst possible with my wife and I sinking towards the middle (Rm 240). The springs were so soft and loud that if we moved, we would be woke up. If only we had a comfortable bed that wasn't a decade in age would I rate it higher. There is a Mexican restaurant sharing the same parking lot or an Italian restaurant just opening across the street. One extra positive note is that the property is sparkling clean and well cared for. Internet is complimentary, flat screen TV's are in the rooms and furnishings are quasi-Asian in blue theme. I couldn't stay here again because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: jadrianb
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here, and enjoyed our stay. We weren't in the room very long, but it was clean, spacious, and well kept. Internet connection was good. Noise level even by the elevator was acceptable. Service was good, friendly, and prompt, and the breakfast was good as well. It's not a 5-star hotel and we weren't looking for one. But it is a great base to sleep after a great day tasting wine. It is very convenient to the main highway. We went all the way up to the Dry Creek Valley and back in a day with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “great service, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: david f
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed here in late January, and the place was great. it looks to have just been remodeled as our room looked practically new. Service was very nice and attentive. Even though we checked in late, around 10:30, Brian at the front desk was very nice and made sure we got an excellent room, and told us about the amenities available, and where to find breakfast in the morning. The room size was good, as well as the king bed was very comfortable. the hotel is in a great location if you plan on wine tasting in Napa Valley, St Helena, or visit the oxbow and wineries in downtown Napa. We didn't try the pool, as it was a little too cold outside, but it looked well maintained. We definitely will be staying there again on future Napa and Sonoma trips.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, convenient, remodeled.”
Reviews.Author: NEHudson
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with nice linens, electronics, and amenities. Continental breakfast included, extremely convenient to Napa proper and Up Valley. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Ivy- Good Place”
Reviews.Author: lonilulo
Reviews.Content: Great place. Stayed in a mini suite that had lots of room and great service. Good location in Napa to visit everything

Reviews.Title: “I Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: AGuyFromHawaii
Reviews.Content: Great location, north of the City of Napa (in other words, closer to the vineyards). Great value, and that's saying a lot for Napa. Newly renovated, spacious rooms that come with a refrigerator for all those great produce/foods you can pick up in the valley to eat in your room. The only thing is that the quality of the furnishings are a little cheap (looks expensive, but they really aren't). But then again, that never bothered me. I spend very little time in the room. It's clean, affordable, well-located, and friendly staff to boot. That's all I care about.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Marie C
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the Ivy! The entire staff was amazingly helpful and very professional. The rooms are very nice, and the bed was more comfortable than any other hotel that I've stayed at in Napa! We'll stay here again! The breakfast area is very clean, well stocked and is more than adequate. The refrigerators in the rooms are a very nice touch, as is the huge tv and amazing bedding. Well done BW!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal G
Reviews.Content: This was a spur of the moment weekend in Napa and I was looking for a nice hotel that wasn't too expensive. I came across the Best Western in Napa and decided to book a room. I was pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff (Brian) was very friendly and courteous. He even made recommendations for dinner and made reservations for us at Cole's Chop House (check out my review for that). The room was clean and free of bed bugs (I ALWAYS check for them). The continental breakfast was a little hokey (not enough selections), but that's the only minus I could think of. The bed was comfortable with plenty of blankets and pillows. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: bryanh36
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Clean and Currency friendly, the 3 C's - all good :)

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: I am so glad my friend recommended we stay in this hotel! The location is great: easy to get to right off of Highway 29 (for those who don't know the area, Highway 29 is a small highway, and the fact that this hotel is close to the highway in no way means that it is noisy) and conveniently located for access to other wine country towns like Yountville. The decor of this hotel is classy Alice-in-Wonderland, with very high-backed chairs and bright blues. Very very cool. I would most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “we both had a spider bite”
Reviews.Author: katherine c
Reviews.Content: the hotel is accessible bec its just along the road.but i dont recommend their cleanliness esp. in their sheets. they dont change it everyday and their towels also. me & my bf fr another state jst came over to visit me and and we got a spider bite 2 days before he left for a 1 week of staying here.we felt bad about it bec. we thought we enjoyed our stay there but we suffered and had to go to the er just to check it out. we can hardly walk and suffered with it because of what happened. i dont recommend to stay here!!! too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights, and It is my new favorite wine country hotel. The newly remodeled rooms are spacious, comfy, and have the coolest decor. On my first night the staff helped me get a taxi to dinner, and when I got back Katherine at the front desk set me up for wine tasting the next day. The staff made my stay enjoyable and I still can't believe how awesome the rooms were. I've already made plans for a return trip with a group of girlfriends this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, good value, but still a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: mrs_wright07
Reviews.Content: We spent the first two days of 2012 in Napa, and due to the holiday weekend, it was hard for me to find a good hotel on short notice. The staff was very courteous and professional. The lobby is clean and the location is good. The rooms look good on the website, but look cheap and tacky in person. The rooms adjoin by door, so you can hear everything if you have noisy neighbors. We were "blessed" to have a room full of kids next door with the parents across the hall, so they would put the latch so the door would be cracked and would run across the hall and each time the door would SLAM. This went on until midnight. I should've just had them move us, and we might've had a better experience, but who wants to change rooms once you're in your Pjs? The bed was clean and comfortable, and there was a nice big TV. The bathroom did not appear to be renovated like the rest of the room and the tub was discolored. The continental breakfast was appreciated but the room was filled with people barefoot and in their pajamas and screaming babies. I find this the case most anywhere with a continental breakfast. What happened to etiquette? Two more good things about the hotel: The mexican restaurant next door is good. Also, if you ask the front desk they will give you wine tasting coupons. This is a good idea if it's your first trip and have no idea where to go. Any hotel will likely have these, so if in doubt just ask. Napa is magical, and we still enjoyed it, but next time we will splurge and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for your wine country adventures!!”
Reviews.Author: MaxCircus
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here for two nights and it is a perfect hotel for visiting all the nearby wineries. it is literally a minute from Route 29. Front desk was very helpful at checkin, providing a wine map and a few tasting passes. Rooms have been recently updated and have very comfortable bedding. Have the largest flat-screen TV I have seen at a hotel. Loved the ceiling mounted shower head. Highly recommend if your objective is to be in a central location to so many wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: JenHowell
Reviews.Content: got it as a 'name your price' deal on Priceline for a one night stop in Napa. Beds were VERY comfortable and rooms were beautiful. Didn't get a chance to use the pool but looked very nice. Breakfast was a good variety, only hot food was make your own waffles, but no eggs or anything..

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: advntr_skr
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to spend too much for a hotel in Napa, but want a decent, modern hotel this is your place. It is on the northern part of Napa (not downtown), making it easily accessible to Yountville. We originally wanted to stay in Yountville for one night, but the hotels were averaging $200-300+ a night. We wanted to save that money and spend it on a great meal. I'm glad we did. For only $130/night (off season prices, of course), we were able to splurge on dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Ivy_1135805
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, nice rooms, helpful staff and good location. Great deal in a very expensive area. Much nicer than any Best Western I've ever been at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locations, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingwrld2010
Reviews.Content: The loactin of the hotel is great. It's right next to the wine train or about 20 mins to place you might want to see in Napa area, like the wineries, Yountville, Rutherford, and other areas. It's a great base to explore the area. The hotel is average. It provides the basic amenities, good size rooms, gym, pool, breakfast included. The staff was very nice and friendly. IF you're looking for a decent place to just sleep and don't care about ambience of the hotel, then this should work just fine. I think next time I go to Napa I would stay somewhere with more character. The staff was very nice and helpful. They gave us a bunch of wine passes and gave us a complimentary late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in wine country”
Reviews.Author: lowens311
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our 2 night stay at The Ivy. This is NOT your granny's Best Western...it is sleek, sophisticated and lush. The bed and linens are wonderul and the whole room was modern and lovely. The breakfast bar is continental with a waffle iron, but lovely, and FREE! The staff was very nice and we had no issues here. We had a wine shuttle pick us up and drop us for for a day of tasting in the country, it was awesome. After the long day, we managed to walk ourselves across the parking lot to this yummy mexican rest right next to the parking lot (recommend that)...Red Rooster or something along those lines. You will not regreat a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service at Ivy Hotel Napa”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: A group of us recently stayed at The Ivy hotel. It was a last minute trip. When we arrived the young lady at the front desk helped us with dinner reservations, set up winery tours for us and even got us all on a balloon ride at the last minute.We felt very welcomed indeed. Five star customer service . Can't wait to return in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wine Country Stay”
Reviews.Author: burg415
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay after wine tasting for the day. Quiet rooms are very clean, remodeled recently with flat screen TV, microwave, fridge, & a great firm bed & linens. Not your typical Best Western. Great value, too -- free parking, internet and includes a decent breakfast, too. Front desk & all are very accomodating & courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Ryan B
Reviews.Content: The location and value are great. You are located a few minutes from Yountville where a lot of awesome restaurants are located and also, not far from some of the top wineries in Yountville, Oakville, Rutherford, etc. It has been updated and modernized so it feels new and clean. It also has a nice complimentary continental breakfast, which offers a nice start to a day of wine tasting and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Above average in Napa”
Reviews.Author: al_parkcity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on a visit to Napa Valley. The hotel was better than I expected for a Best Western. It has be renovated fairly recently so it doesn't seem like an ordinary chain hotel. The location is reasonably central so getting places was easy.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for budget minded travelers to Napa”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: I had a short one night stay at this hotel. I would recommend it for budget minded travelers to Napa or for very short trips. From the outside, it looks like a former motel that has been refurbished. Inside, it is a little more modern and the rooms are cute. Small rooms with interesting decor. Comfortable bed. Nice staff, with free breakfast, free computer station, outdoor pool and hottub and a central Napa location. Two small points, on one side of the building you are facing the highway, so you can expect a little noise. I got used to it. Also, as you enter they have these orange stripes on the stairs (looks like orange duct tape) that is a little tacky. Obviously to warn you of the stairs but it is one of the first things you see in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: chicago90Phoenix
Reviews.Content: This isn't your grandmother's Best Western Hotel. The rooms and interior design of this hotel space was quite impressive and had a "wow" impact. The bathroom shower (directly above your head), modern sink and comfortable king size bed made me want to stay longer. Great location for hitting both the main Napa wine trail, downtown Napa and the Silverado Trail. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, updated hotel, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel in November 2011. It has a boutique feel and nice decor, an acceptable breakfast with waffle maker, updated rooms, and nice bathroom with tub. The staff is friendly and the Management is available and involved. A bonus is a complimentary bottle of sauvignon blanc upon check-in! Ample free parking and business center. The rooms are a little noisy due to thin walls but overall, we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfort at an Affordable Price in the heart of Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: happyhoneymooners_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great if you're looking for a moderately priced hotel without the stuffy frills. You get a free continental breakfast every morning, free wifi, an excellent workout room with brand new equipment, and large rooms with a generous sitting area. The decor is really nice, too for being a Best Western! We were really surprised at how nice everything was. The front desk agents were extremely helpful, too--very willing to help us with our wine country map, give recommendations, free/discount tasting coupons, etc. It was a very peaceful, quiet hotel right in the middle of napa valley--equidistant to the Yountville/Rutherford area and Sonoma wineries. It's convienently located right off hwy 29 (main wine trail), and there's a grocery store, gas stations, restaurants, etc. all around yet it still doesn't have a "city" feel. And better yet, it has a heated pool and hot tub! Great place to stay. I highly recommend. My only complaint was I wish the breakfast included a couple more hot foods like eggs and biscuits instead of just a self-serve waffle machine, but hey! It was still great and filling.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for the Napa area.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in transit to San Francisco. The hotel was very comfortable, especially the bed. We both enjoyed a very good night's sleep. The room was spacious and fitted out well for both business or leisure stays. Breakfast was included in the tarrif and was served in a breakfast room. The food was good but nothing special - basic hotel fare. Parking on site is free and the car park is well lit. Location is pretty good. It's on the outskirts of Napa but placed within easy reach of shops, the township and restaurants. However, the restaurants will require driving. There is a "cheap & cheerful" Mexican restaurant next door. Good food, reasonable prices and good service for this type of establishment. If you aren't looking for the Michelin Star experience it could be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Beter than expected”
Reviews.Author: fromcincy
Reviews.Content: Three of us girls stayed in a 2 queen bed room, and were pleasantly surprised by the how spacious the room was. We quite enjoyed the inclusive breakfast and the possibility to eat dinner at a nice Mexican restaurant just outside the parking lot. There is a small fitness facility on site, and I got to try the treadmill, not the latest model but it serves the purpose. Overall, we glad to find this hotel, very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nicehotel, excellent staff, but loud at night”
Reviews.Author: CS H
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via one of the bidding websites for just a tad over $100, and was upgraded to the suite upon arrival. The rooms was large, spacious, and very clean. That said, it is still a Best Western, so don't expect too much with the Premier tag. The heated pool outside was fun even with the fall breeze. The only downside is the loud noise from the trucks and buses that are constantly driving on the highway, especially during the busy harvest seasons (Late summer to Fall). Unless you're a deep sleeper, you'll be interrupted a few times during the night. I probably wouldn't pay the full listed price, but if you can get it for cheaper, it's a nice hub to visit the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: LilysueCEO
Reviews.Content: During the busy Fall weekends, it can be difficult to find a nice hotel in Napa and some require a 2 nights stay, so we selected this hotel. It was easy to find but there was some road noise but fairly quite during the night. The room felted somewhat crowded with newly remodeled furniture but perhaps too much. I didn't like the set up for the sink for the bathroom since there are no towel bar. The breakfast was very good. We got there early so there was not an issue with crowds and the selection was excellent. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The room was clean as were the common areas. Parking was excellent and close to your room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel at a reasonable rate for Napa”
Reviews.Author: PSUFAN05
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been renovated. It was the only hotel that had availability during my recent trip to Napa. It was reasonably priced for the area and very nice on the inside. I was surprised it is considered a Premier resort given how small it is. I live in Lancaster, PA and the Best Western Premier Eden resort here is a huge conference center with multiple pools, dinning rooms etc. This just seemed more of a decent hotel. The complimentary breakfast was nice to have.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LiquidAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and highly recommended. Very easy to find, clean and is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Noise level is high”
Reviews.Author: Vroomin61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, clean, spacious, chic but ask for a room away from the road!!! Traveling with our elderly parents so we asked for quiet rooms that would be close together, 1 out of two we got. What a noisy place to stay. It sits at a 4 way stop so you hear the cars and truck gun through the intersection almost all night. Went to bed at 1am and the tragic was still going. So if you are used to city noise you could probably stay here. Rooms are nice up to date decor, nice mattresses, could have had a great stay if it wasn't for the road noise. Breakfast that is provided was average.

Reviews.Title: “we recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ErnestTito
Reviews.Content: Well located on Napa Valley, the rooms were large, nice and clean. There is a large swimming pool and a spa. The Mexican grill next to the hotel is definitely a place to go for lunch !

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: goldtown
Reviews.Content: When I heard that a national hotel chain had purchased and refurbished the old Chateau Hotel, I was pleased that Best Western had invested in the community. It's a great location, with a pool - perfect for families. So when I needed to go to Napa on a business trip, I decided to check it out - and while the lobby is newly refurbished and the continental breakfast is a definite plus, the room was not up to par. The minor updates were really poorly done (towel bars are mounted on a poorly painted 1x4 piece of wood with a screw that shows throught the paint and the closet doors have been replaced with a door covered with contact paper). The unfinished tile on the bathroom floor was home to the pet spider (see picture). I'm hoping that the 'refurbishing' effort continues.

Reviews.Title: “Another Napa Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RWells5733
Reviews.Content: As a Bestwestern rewards member I got a good offer on this hotel. As a premier hotel I was expecting a great location and a great room. The location for this hotel is bad. It is off the main highway but it is a long way from anything you might want to do, eat, drink, etc. There is a Mexican restaurant next door, but the food I got was poor for any location! I do not recommend eating at this restaurant. The hotel rooms have a late 60's early 70's retro look, lots of bright colors and funky lights. We stayed here only 2 nights before we left and went to the Bestwestern plus at the vines. I would say the BW plus at the vines was a much better hotel than this, especially the location and hotel furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Three Nights in Napa”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be over priced, in other places! But here in Napa it was actually lower then alot of other similar hotels. The rooms have been refreshed recently, and are very large. I thought breakfast was quite good and they always made sure there was lots of food out. Seating can be a problem but we always managed to find a spot. The bed matresses could use to be replaced soon as our king bed did have a visable low spot in the middle, although surprisingly it was still really comfy. There was tons of free parking. We really liked the Mexican Resturant next door, the food was great and really good prices. All in all I would recommend this hotel. Unless your willing to pay "a lot" more your not going to get that wine country ambience. We didn't come to Napa to spend much time in our room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Fun modern decor”
Reviews.Author: evil_lina
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for two nights while in Napa to enjoy some of the restaurants and wineries. The weekend rate was rather high but then you don't go to Napa for a bargain. Compared to other area accommodations it's reasonably priced. I'll admit that I booked partially on the strength of the room photos with the funky decor and wasn't disappointed one bit. The room was exactly as pictured, felt clean, and everything looked nice and new. Not a bad location for exploring Napa and Yountville, which were our prime destinations. The free continental breakfast was well stocked with the sorts of cereals, danishes, and beverages you'd expect to find at a chain hotel's breakfast. In other words, nothing fancy but enough to get you going in the morning and helped offset the cost of fine dining the rest of the day. They kindly put us in a quiet room at the back of the building at our request and we had no trouble sleeping through the night. The free happy hour Friday evening was an added bonus. All in all a nice alternative if the fancy inns and hotels in the area are out of your price range but you still want comfort and a little luxury.

Reviews.Title: “You can polish a.... But it's still....”
Reviews.Author: scubascaff
Reviews.Content: I really didn't have a good stay here. Ive stayed at nicer regular Best Westerns than this "premier" hotel. To start, everything is fake, made to look upscale. Fake wood, fake stones, fake tiles, everything. The decorator needs to be fired- very cold, dark, and uninviting- made to look modern and chic. Housekeeping was horrid. We came back and I swear all they did was make the bed and give fresh towels (which you are only given two- very inconvenient when you're traveling with two people and they also don't supply pool towels). Empty plastic bottles left on the counter and toilet paper left unstocked. This is wine country. People are going to be dehydrated. The soda machine was broken the whole week we were there, and didn't look like there was any intention of fixing it. The front desk has some beverages for sale, but they can't seem to stock a bottle of water? Isn't hospitality the name of the game?? Breakfast is crowded, and as hard as the girls work, they can't keep up with the fact that there was never enough seating, and not enough recources to properly serve breakfast. There is ONE waffle machine. For at least thirty people a morning. And guess what- there isn't much else served as far as being filling, so naturally, everyone flocks to the waffle machine. Do the math, if you're standing in a line that's seven people long, and each waffle takes at least 2 minutes to cook and a lot of people make two, you're standing in line for over 20 minutes. How in the world do they not see that this is a problem?? Their only saving grace was the hot tub. Even that needed work, as the paint is so chipped and faded that it looks like there is a bucket of sand in there. I was so happy to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTrisha
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in the land of overpriced. I would stay again in a heartbeat. Friendly staff, good breakfast, pretty pool, great decor. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: jmukurls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ivy for two nights for a friend's wedding. The hotel was clean and quiet. The staff was nice and friendly. The room was clean and the bed super comfortable. There is a complimentary breakfast every morning that has your standard hotel selections...bagels, muffins, cereal, hard boiled eggs, coffee/tea. They also had a waffle making station. The pool area was nice and also had a hot tub. There is also a nice outdoor patio with tables near the breakfast area to relax. Wineries and several restaurants are also close by. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Ivy!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't expect this much”
Reviews.Author: doctort
Reviews.Content: When you go to Napa during or close to the harvest, you will find it difficult to find a room. We wanted to go to Yountville- but every room we wanted was booked. Alas, this hotel was in North Napa- and needing a lot of room (because we are parents with a toddler) we chose this hotel, with a suite. The room was huge- complete with refrigerator, sink, kitchen table, and lots of room for the toddler to roam. The price was inexpensive compared to other hotel suites in the area and Yountville Yountville is only a few minutes away- so we were able to go to great Thomas Keller restaurants- Bouchon and Ad Hoc- without difficulty. This is a hidden gem on the north side of Napa- worth staying at. Price is very reasonable. Rooms are clean. I don't care about free breakfast - but the yogurt and fruit for my son was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Motorcycle Trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: JGNY7100
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a good location especially given the rates at some better lodging in the area this was a bargain (under $200 a nite). My wife wasn't comfortable that the rear door to the facility was unlocked all night, it had a security system that was obviously out of order. Overall the hotel served the purpose at a reasonable rate. We spent two nights and we were out early and back late. Nice easy Mexican restaurant next store which stayed open late, the Napa Valley generally rolls up the streets fairly early. I would recommend this as a good value for the dollars spent, if you looking for a really nice place move up the valley a little to Yountville which had some really great places like the Villagio which we checked out and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Paul_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: From arrival to check out this was a great hotel. Great customer service, gorgeous room - clean, quite spacious and very comfortable over our two night stay. Spent some time in the pool and spa (good condition) and explored a number of winderies and eateries in the area. A great stayb with free parking and breakfast included. PS The Mexican restaurant next door was cheap and good quality.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: cabo13
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding in Napa over the weekend & made a reservation at the Best Western Ivy Premier. We paid $300 a night (and 2 night minimum) for what they called a suite. It was roomy enough but not worth $300 per night. The walls are paper thin and the beds are horrible. It was soft on the sides & lumpy in the middle. The maids came and made the bed only - didnt clean the bathroom, wipe the table or anything. We came back to the hotel late on the first night & there is a restaruant next door and we had trouble finding a place to park. The doors to get into the building say that you need to use your room key to get in but they were not locked, it didn't feel very safe. We had no remote for the tv's, we let housekeeping know that the remotes were missing and they acted like it was a big surpise that we wanted a remote. I just felt like I was paying top dollar just because it was Napa. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I have paid less for much much more. They also advertise a heated pool - its not.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: pjwb
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Yountville. Loved the wine tasting during the happy hour. Great suite! we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: OregonSpots
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently remodeled and the decor seeks to be trendy - the execution however lacked in a number of areas. Examples include a towel rack mounted on a poorly painted 2x4 and a combination dresser/entertainment center that was freakishly wide and left little room to navigate between the bed and the dresser. The location is a convenient drive to all of the local wineries; there are no restaurants right near by. Its location is across from a very busy highway, so the setting isn't picturesque, but we were able to see a great deal of Napa, Sonoma, and surrounding towns easily. We found the bed to be very comfortable with a selection of pillows to suit your taste. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. A breakfast was included which is always appreciated. It had the standard waffle maker and cereal; however when paying $225/night, the plastic utensils were an unwelcome surprise. Overall the hotel provides adequate accommodations; very similar in feel to a Marriott Courtyard. My expectations were higher so came away disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay for our stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: EnrohStyles
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel mid August while doing the whole wine tasting thing. The staff in the lobby were all very courteous and helpful, asking if we needed any help with wineries in the area. In addition, there was a wine tasting happening on the patio that evening. I'm not sure how often it happens, but it was a nice intro to our weekend. The rooms were clean and spacious with a very modern style of decor my girlfriend really appreciated. The only main issue we had dealt with the television. 50% of the channels were either fuzzy or didn't come in at all. We called the front desk and they sent someone over, but when all was said and done, the problem wasn't fixed (And no explination was given). We weren't there to watch TV, but it would have been nice for some of the downtime in the area. Breakfast was nice; all the basics. Overall we were pretty happy with the place. A bit pricey; We'd definitely go back if the price were better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, suprisingly modern and well designed”
Reviews.Author: JEAV
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here and it was better than expected. The hotel is newer with clean modern design with a microwave and fridge (love that). There is a pool and jacuzzi which is great to have to unwind and spend some time in the afternoon sun. The manager was really nice and helpful, super friendly. The continental breakfast was great, they had a waffle maker which I used for the first time in my life (yum)! One drawback is that it is right off the highway, but the plus side is really convenient for visiting the wineries. Very nice hotel and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel / bad bed”
Reviews.Author: Houstontravellovers
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Ivy in August. Hotel was clean. Staff was friendly. Plenty of parking. Breakfast was OK but loud. The main problem was the beds were very uncomfortable. Stiff and cheap. I stay in about 50 hotels a year and this was the worst bed I have slept in years. We both hated the bed more each day. We asked to change rooms but were told all the beds were the same. I would avoid this hotel unless you are OK with sleeping on the ground.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: treddd
Reviews.Content: Nice, new rooms, great to have a pool, slightly odd location by the freeway (but actually worked out well, as it is between downtown napa and yountville, which made travelling around the region very easy).

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: Seattle48
Reviews.Content: Our friends' wedding was Aug 20th and we had wine tasting and a welcome reception in Yountville on the 19th...so staying here worked out well, since it was only about a 5+ minute drive to Yountville. We stayed in Room 129 which faces onto the pool, lovely but hardly used...I guess everyone was busy wine tasting? We enjoyed a very nice dinner our first night at Oxbow Market. Yes, the light switch in the closet was a little weird and the walls/floors a little thin, but overall we thought the remodel a success. I used the business center to check in for our return flight, yes only one computer, but I was the only one there! The breakfast was very busy, but they seemed to keep up. I liked the waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Wedding Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SteveG123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married in Napa Valley in May 2011. We scouted out accommodations in Jan 2011 right when the Ivy Hotel was being renovated. In fact, we met the new GM - Jeff Perry - at a wedding event while there. He nicely showed us what the hotel renovations would result in along with the spectacular rates (for Napa and for this location just N of City of Napa along the Wine Highway) they would have for us when we came back. Based on his great presentation/overview, we decided to use the Ivy Hotel as our primary accommodations for over 50 family and guests. Jeff and his staff were fantastic to deal with as our YES RSVPs came in and arrival/departure plans were made. Needless to say, we were a bit worried about this hotel since they had just opened a month or so earlier, so we held our breath as the guests started arriving on Thursday AM in mid-May 2011. We were thrilled when every single wedding party guest was not only satisfied with their accommodations but also with the staff at the Ivy. They liked the breakfast in the AM, they liked the modernistic rooms, they liked the rates (we paid for a lot of our families directly). I heard only a few complaints that the floors/walls are a bit thin so you can hear people walking in the halls at night/morning. So. Why only 3 stars, then? Sadly, we've had little/no luck in getting Jeff Perry back on the phone/Email since our wedding weekend ended to discuss the bill. We believe - in the checkout confusion - that our personal credit card was overcharged for some guest room nights. We're not sure, but we THINK this is accurate based on our spreadsheet calculations. No amount of phone calls or Emails to Jeff or his staff seems to warrant a call-back or acknowledgement that they will help us work this out so we don't feel overcharged. We're bummed that this experience ended so negatively as everything else went so darn well. So - I'll say this - great renovation. Great location if you want easy access to wineries. Great staff. Don't count on them helping you at all if something goes wrong with your bill. :-(

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: miznina
Reviews.Content: This was a family stay, with 2 kids (ages 12 and 14). I am pleased to say that, with all the remodeling, you still get a large room with 2 queen beds (I've noticed that sometimes when hotels remodel, they put in double beds to make the room seem larger). Everything did seem brand, sparkling new and I have nothing but positive comments to make. The layout of the bedroom is such that the sink is outside the bathroom, and there's an extra large space next to it for placing all the toiletries (much appreciated; I wish all hotels would think of this). There's only 1 strange quirk to the room (or our room) which may be a result of the remodeling: the first hallway light switch you need when you go in the room is INSIDE THE CLOSET. Once you find it, you'll notice there's actually a little cutout on the closet door to flip the switch. Breakfast was included, and the breakfast was substantial, the attendants working full speed all morning to satisfy all the tourists who need lots of food to sustain them through the day's wine tastings. We were also really impressed with the front desk, both in the evening when we checked in quite late and in the morning when we asked for local directions. Also, housekeeping came to our aid almost immediately even though it was very late in the evening. As a previous reviewer has said, don't be disuaded by the Best Western name. It doesn't fit the Best Western stereotype... and in a very good way!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: wizbud
Reviews.Content: Found this gem travelling south from Calistoga...very new and so well equipped it's hard to know where to start! The rooms are ultra modern and comfortable..we thought there would be noise from the road but no, we had agreat night's sleep. Breakfast was excellent and the staff very helpful. Convenient Mexican restaurant next door so we didn't have to drive again after a long day in the car.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: fkhaven
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline while bidding for a 3 star quality hotel. I have not cared for Best Westerns in the past and was a little concerned when I got this one. Apparently there are 3 property levels and this one was their top level, premier. I was impressed upon arrival when entering the hotel lobby and seeing how clean the area was. The tile floors just sparkled. Check-in was easy and quick. We were traveling with another couple and were given 2 rooms close to each other on the 1st floor. This hotel is newly remodeled & updated. The rooms were clean and modern. There was a microwave, mini fridge and a safe in the room. The pool area outside was very nice and had pool furniture with cushions and (cloth)umbrellas, tables; not just your standard plastic that you see so often by a pool. The free breakfast was more than just dry pastries and juice. You could make your own waffles. There was plenty of fresh fruit, juices, hard boiled eggs. pastries, yogurt and other things to choose from. There was also an area to eat outside with nice tables, chairs and umbrellas. We arrived on a Weds. night and the next morning I noticed the safe was in a locked position. When I went to the front desk she politely informed me that the maintenance man was not in but she would send the manager down as soon as he arrived. He was there within in the half hour and re-set the safe for me. They have a computer available for free use. We purchased some baseball tickets online for a game in San Fran but were unable to print them because the printer was out of ink. The front desk clerk allowed me to come down to the front desk and print them there. That was typical of the service we received there. I felt their entire staff, manager included, went out of their way to make our stay as nice as possible. I would defintely stay at this hotel again. The location was convenient to town and the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: Erock33626
Reviews.Content: On a whim we decided to drive up to Napa from San Francisco for a few days. Unfortunately, most of the hotels Yountvilee, St. Helena, etc. were booked. So we decided to try the Ivy Hotel by Best Western. And what a great surprise! The rooms were huge and very comfortable (all recently remodeled), and the location was great. We were literally 10 minutes from Youtnville yet we only paid half the price of staying in Yountville. If you want to see Napa but not pay a fortune to do it - this place is for you. And there is a great restaurant two blocks away (Fume)....make sure you check that out too.

Reviews.Title: “A 4* at a 2* price”
Reviews.Author: Shivauna
Reviews.Content: Wow - amzaing for a Best Western - don't be detered by the brand flag. A bit south of the wineries, which added extra time to getting around - but incredible rooms, tons of room, nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fully Renovated Hotel and Gateway to Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: DG_Allen
Reviews.Content: I was very warmly greeted by the front desk staff upon checking in. We were two hours early but they had our room ready to go with no problems. Very good service from the staff. The property and rooms have been completely redone. There is only slight evidence of the original building in a door or railing here and there. It looks great and is very modern. The renovations appear to be complete, we saw no signs of construction. Basically ingore any reivews of this hotel prior to April or May 2011. It's essentially a new properlt. We had a single king room and liked the layout, there were nice windows and a couple big comfortable sitting chairs. The bed was comfortable but not the best ever. The bathroom was stylish and functional. The small fridge worked well and was not noisy. The pool looked nice and was enjoyed by other guests but we did not use it. I used the free wi-fi a few times and it worked well with no setup issue. The best thing was the how nice a hotel this was for price - especially for it being Napa. Compared with the rest of the Napa hotels this place ranges from being a bargain to a complete steal!. We had more free cash to eat great food and buy wine! The location is also great right off highway 29 at the north end of the city of Napa. It's 5 minutes from downtown Napa and about 8 minutes from Yountville (when there is no traffic!). Overall we had a great experience at the Ivy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nyckala
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Ivy was great. All the rooms have been recently renovated and it shows. The staff are extremly friendly. The pool was great after a day of wine tasting, all the outdoor furniture is very nice. As an added bonus there is free breakfast. The breakfast bar was crowded, but the staff made sure everything was refilled as needed. I would definitley recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in the perfect location for Napa!”
Reviews.Author: hollypyatt
Reviews.Content: When I first saw Best Western, I questioned how nice this place could really be. It was that nice and more! The decorations were modern, artsy, and adorable. The room was spacious and had a bar area with a refrigerator. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about the area. The breakfast was a great addition each morning. There is an outside seating area with comfortable picnic tables and lounge seating for meals. The pool and hot tub was great. The location was perfect. It was minutes from downtown Napa. It was located right off of the main highway that leads to all of the Napa county wineries. You are just a couple of miles from the beginning of all the wineries. Made tastings and tours, then running back to the hotel for a mid-day breather perfect. Would definitely stay there next time we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff are very friendly”
Reviews.Author: sourdough_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend to attend a wedding. Location of hotel is closed to the wedding site and they are less expensive than most highly rated local hotels. Front desk clerks and Hotel GM , Jeff, were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was crowded, and breakfast area is a bit too small for the number of rooms and guests they have However quality of the food was very good and they also excellent coffee. Rooms have been remodeled, but I don't like the decor they picked. All in all, it is an acceptable hotel for the money I spent.

Reviews.Title: “If you didn't see the sign, I bet you wouldn't know this is a Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Flafreckles
Reviews.Content: They did a phenomenal job with the remodel. Design aesthetics aside, the bedding was nice. The shower was hot with great water pressure. You can even make your own waffle in the morning for breakfast. The location alone is very convenient to all the vienyards. You can get to Yountville in a few minutes. Eveyrone on the staff is really helpful and friendly. Every single person greeted us with a smile and a Hello. The only items out of the ordinary were 1) the lack of an alarm clock and 2) the doors that SLAM shut if you are not careful. All in all, save your money to buy more wine and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Beautifully Redesigned!”
Reviews.Author: LoveNapaYn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 years ago when it was The Chateau and what a dump! It was disgusting!!! I would never have stayed here again but I have some friends in town that told me about the renovations the hotel has undergone so we decided to give it a second chance. I'm so glad we did too!!! The staff was very professional and helpful, they even made our dinner reservations for us and directed us to fabulous wineries to visit. Breakfast was very nice and the rooms were extremely comfortable and beautifully designed. The location can't be beaten. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and access to enjoy the Valley”
Reviews.Author: vinotour
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this newly renovated hotel twice now in the last 30 days. If there are "kinks" to work out, we didn't see any. Staff are very professional and accommodating at check in and check out. The amenities, furnishings,and breakfast are streamlined for busy travelers like us. For the price and proximity to Hwy 29 and all the Napa Valley wine destinations nearby, this hotel is a better choice than higher priced hotels farther away. Next time we come to Napa Valley, when the weather is better, we plan to enjoy the loaner bikes and the nice pool / hot tub areas.

Reviews.Title: “Odd experience”
Reviews.Author: jag1jag1
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Napa at the last minute, and this was the only hotel available. The renovations and room seemed fine. We spent one night at the hotel, and when I got home, I realized that I had left my cell phone plug in the wall (I had the cord, but the plug had become disconnected.) I immediately phoned the hotel, and they found the plug. They asked for a credit card number to charge the postage, which we gave them. I didn't receive the plug. I made multiple phone calls, with varying responses. Sometimes the person had no idea what I was talking about; one person said that the manager had to approve the mailing; several times they insisted that the package had been mailed, but they gave me different dates (we never were charged for the postage). The phone piece never arrived. At the end the manager asked me to email my address again, said that he would look into the matter, and that was the last that I heard from anyone. Admittedly, I made a mistake of leaving something in the room, but the whole experience after that was very strange.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not quite spectacular”
Reviews.Author: artygal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights recently, got a AAA discount, which helped a lot. Clean. Comfortable. Friendly. Easy check in. Nicely decorated room. Good light. Stayed on the upper floor. Has an elevator, which was helpful for my elderly mother. Fun details on the recent remodel; hallway carpet, comfy chairs in lobby, fun light fixtures. A few situations made the stay less than perfect; our mini fridge was replaced because it wasn't cooling our drinks/food, then the replacement didn't work either. Staff said they have had problems with them for a while. The hall light in our room flickered at night, it too was replaced, but still flickered, so maybe a short in the wiring instead of a faulty bulb? Lastly the complementary breakfast was fine, but still so average: waffles, boiled eggs, yogurt, muffins, fruit salad. All tasty, but wanted more for the price. (Better yogurt, bakery items not from Costco, ripe fruit in the salad.) But for the Napa area, free parking, free breakfast, clean & safe rooms; worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled? Kind of...”
Reviews.Author: stevesuz
Reviews.Content: We saw decent reviews of this hotel as an updated property here on TripAdvisor so we booked, although I rarely stay at Best Western properties. First, the good. The location is very handy, although it is on the highway and a room at the front of the property is noisy. The first impression is very favorable, the lobby and the common space are nice and modern. They have a wine tasting one night which was very pleasant. The patio is a lovely place to have wine and cheese. Upon check-in, I asked to be switched to a room that wasn't at the top of the stairs and they couldn't or wouldn't accomodate that request. Also they were confused about how to credit my stay to the Southwest Airlines rapid rewards so I decided to drop that and pursue it later. The elevator was out of service the entire time we were there (5 nights). The top step was oddly taller than the rest and is a fall risk. Our room had been remodeled or was in the process. The wall paper was new but had many tears and holes. There was sheetrock dust, the counters and the towels rack were not installed properly. The bathroom pocket door didn't work. The other bathroom door stuck, the toilet has a slow leak, the lights in the bath and hall flickered. The frig never got cold, even on the lowest setting. And they have this weird clock that cold have been used in a lighthouse. This is a personal preference, but we found the mattress way too hard. We had to ask repeatedly for toiletries and enough towels. The pictures posted by the hotel show three computers in the business center but there's only one, if that's an issue for your stay. We didn't use the pool or gym. The breakfast was a rather passive-aggressive affair. They just didn't stay on top of the demand--had to ask for napkins,plates, more coffee, tea bags, or something every day. I asked if they had more bagels and the woman said no, so we ate some dry muffins and as we were leaving, voila, bagels magically appear. Every morning people were complaining. Our last morning there, as I was talking to another guest (he told me a mirror fell off his wall) and the microwave shorted out. With some of the other reviews, it seems the hotel has some electrical issues. We received a "Newly Remodeled" rate (same as AAA) but think it should have been "Please Excuse out Dust" rate, because our suite clearly wasn't completed. Since we were on to go most of the time, we should have just stayed at something cheaper, like a Comfort Inn. Napa is so small, location really isn't an issue with getting downtown or to the wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Room Issues Spoiled my Stay”
Reviews.Author: vagabond_biker
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give this place a good review but I had too many room issues. First was when I had to call maintenance to unlock the bathroom door. After that was fixed, I noticed the door stop was misaligned such that when the bathroom door is fully opened (which it has to be in order to enter) the door stop pushes the door lock button. Obviously, this has happened before and will happen again. After a short time in the room I noticed the toilet tank would refill for a few seconds about every 5 minutes. I reported that to the front desk and was told maintenance would be available in about 45 minutes. I went out to dinner and upon return asked if the problem had been fixed. I was told maintenance could find no problem. Back in my room the toilet tank refill continued and I called maintenance again and insisted he wait at least 5 minutes. It took less than 5 minutes. I was then informed that a part had to be replaced and he would return in 30 minutes. I asked the front desk if another room was available and was moved across the hall. After packing and moving and settling in I resumed watching the TV channel I was watching before except it wasn't there. A quick scan showed more than half the channels to be missing. Called maintenance again. It was quickly determined that the A/V panel was missing, something which was known to maintenance but apparently not to to the people assigning rooms. I was then moved to a third room. Not happy at this point. At no time was an apology made for my inconvenience nor an offer to upgrade the room. None was needed, but perhaps if either had been forthcoming I would not be writing this review.

Reviews.Title: “Chaotic Process for late checkout-still renovating”
Reviews.Author: cookieladyBayArea
Reviews.Content: Late me describe the time consuming inefficient process to get late check out. We made reservations at the Ivy Hotel because of the close proximity to the Cycle for Sight event on 4-16. At the time of our reservation we were told that our request for late check out would need to be made at check in on 4-15. We checked in on 4-15 and made our request for late check out so we could shower after the biking event. We were told to call when we got up. I worried and did not sleep well over needing to call upon wake up. I called about 6 am and could not get the desk to answer.What if there had been an emergency that a guest needed help? Finally after several attempts the last one from my cell phone I reached the front desk. I was told the person on duty could not grant my request for late check out and it would need to wait until the day shift came on at 7. At 7 on the way to the medicore breakfast my request for late check in was granted by the day shift. This was a ridulous way to handle a rountine request for late check out and not good service to jerk a customer around in this manner. The room was decorated similiar to a bordello with huge teal/sliver geometric wall paper whhich was outdated in the bedroom part which did not match the earth tones of the bathroom. There were no floor boards in the room which further detracted from the bizarre decorating style. I can't ever remember staying in a hotel without floor boards that showed the dry wall. The area between the dresser & the bed was tight and made navigating around the bed difficult. This hotel has a long way to go before it conveys the relaxed luxurious Tuscan feel/style of the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Low Cost Surprise In Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: jgregb
Reviews.Content: First off, I would never have even considered staying here had it not been for the TripAdvisor reviews. The reviews indicated that the property had undergone a significant remodel and had been brought up to date. One review indicated that it was a Best Western mashed up with a W. Not sure I would go that far, but it exceeded my expectations in some areas. The lobby had been updated and was a good first impression. The registration process was fast and efficient. This is where it starts to stray. The elevator was out of order (almost looked permanent, as it never worked in four days). Sure, carrying bags up one flight is certainly no big deal for me, but for some who are not in shape, it could be an issue. The hallway was dark and somewhat dreary. If the hallway had been redone, I would ask for a refund. The doors to the rooms were certainly not new. The rooms were a tale of two issues. The bathroom vanity and bathroom itself had been redone, and were basically tasteful. The remainder of the room was somewhere in between. It was packed with furnishings, and they were borderline eclectic. Not bad, but a little unusual. The bed was comfortable and the mattress was newer. Highspeed wireless is included, and to me that is a bonus. So, that said, would I recommend staying here? Sure, but be aware of a few misses and relish in the value for Napa Valley. Would I stay here again? Yes, in peak season when the rooms elsewhere go upwards of $350 per night to $1000 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of our entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: tdil25
Reviews.Content: I was a little wearly about staying at a Best Western in Napa where there are so many beautiful hotels to choose from but the price couldn't be beaten. This hotel was great! Everything has been updated. The room was very clean. Nice big TV's were also a plus! Overall, I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxed Weekend. A upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albert169
Reviews.Content: It looks like this has been a major update to get this nice. This is Best Westerns top of the line now. And I think it deserves it. New Beds, carpet, plans, lawns, and everything else is new at the hotel I was VERY impressed, the Staff was great. The Elevator was the only item not working. But, it's only two floors. And the bell man was there to take my luggage up to my room. I will be back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: LisaInReno
Reviews.Content: Nicely remodeled hotel. Stayed here on a Sunday night (3/6) and was pleased with the work they have done so far. Very comfortable beds, very friendly staff, convenient and quiet location. They have a business center and fitness room if you need either amenity. I liked the fact that they are within minutes of Downtown Napa and all the wineries in Yountville, Oakville, Rutherford and St. Helena. Easy on and off from Hwy 29.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in modern comfort at the Ivy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nverbanets
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a week trip to California and stayed 2 nights at the Ivy Hotel in Napa. It is located just north of downtown Napa, close enough to reach other eateries, but far from the shops and food downtown. The hotel itself was one of the cleanest and nicest I have every stayed. The staff was very friendly and willing to recommend any places to eat or visit. The only minor hiccup was that the elevator was out of service for construction, but it is not really a problem since the hotel is only 2 floors. The rooms themself were huge! We stayed in a room with a king sized bed, but it was large enough for a bar (microwave and refridgerator) and even an extra king sized bed. The morning breakfast was a perfect way to start any day planned for drinking lots of wine. Also, if you feel you drank and ate too much and have to shed some pounds, check out the beautiful/huge fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by how modern the decor was!”
Reviews.Author: Haseiber
Reviews.Content: Stayed for valentines day weekend, for $140/night, plus free breakfast. First time to napa ever and was pleasantly surprised how great the hotel was! Newly renovated, modern bedroom and the fixtures I loved! Breakfast was typical bagels, cereal, toast, yogurt, juice, coffee setup, but saved us some time in the morning. We stayed on the first floor and at the very end of the wall was some construction work going on but it did not disturb us once during our stay. Next door is a great little Mexican restaurant, which was a plus and margaritas were a nice break from wine tastings. Location for napa was alright, next time I would stay in Yountville as it's more centrally located to wineries I preferred. But I would def stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Fully Completed”
Reviews.Author: raul90606
Reviews.Content: It looks like it will be a nice hotel when its fully completed. The Elevator was not in service, the hallway was not fully clean, a dump of trash was left in the hallaway near the elevator, near our room. Insulation was hanging from the hallway ceiling... The side doors were not working when we first checked in. The front receptionist was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were brand new, nice decor. The morning breakfast was a plus.. It's still 3-4 miles from Downtown Napa.. Next time i will stay near downtown Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Brand New Property”
Reviews.Author: justrod
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I usually have a pretty consistent experience with Best Western. This was definitely a cut above. Our room was super swank and had two of the most comfortable blue chairs I have ever sat in, I even asked where I could buy them. The only drawback, the bathroom mirror was so low I practically had to kneel to shave, I am 6'3" but still. I asked at the front desk for a recommendation for a place to go to dinner with my wife. The guy at the front desk, Jeff, was so knowledgeable and so friendly. It turns out he graduated from culinary school and is a Napa native. There was major looking construction going on down the hall from our room but it never bothered us. This place is definitely under new management, I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Napa, Calif”
Reviews.Author: stjoe95020
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at this Hotel while visiting the Napa Valley. The front desk employees where outstanding. The rooms were clean and the new furniture was very comfortable. The hotel is undergoing renovation but the noise did not bother us at all since the workers left early. The only fault I found was that the morning breakfast was disappointing.. Highly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel at the price of a two star.”
Reviews.Author: Cuamanda
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, very cooperative staff! The rooms are beautiful! Very low price for what they offer. We were hesitant to stay due to the OLD reviews but what we experience, we realized it was the previous hotel. Would not be surprise that by next June rooms are 150 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated...”
Reviews.Author: idnulor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the very final stage of being completely renovated. They've done an amazing job in the design and construction. They have new ownership and management. You will not be disappoited. My friend and I went to visit 12 Napa Valley Hotels to find a location that would be acceptable for family and friends attending her daughter's wedding. We were thoroughly disappointed in the first 11 hotels but then we came to the Ivy Hotel in Napa and we were both pleasantly surprised. You won't be disappointed. Ignore the low customer ratings that you may see on this hotel because those are carry over from the prior owner and prior hotel prior to renovation. There wasn't another hotel even close to this hotel in a similar price range. The other hotels smelled or were just old and out dated. Look no further...the Ivy Best Western Hotel in Napa is a great choice and truly the best there is in the area for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation 90% Complete - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRSMyrtleBeachSC
Reviews.Content: After reading the earlier reviews, I was hesitant, but took a chance since we were staying only one night. I expected a renovation mess, but there were hardly any signs of the previous hotel. Everything from the rooms to the lobby to the breakfast area is new with carpet, furniture and wall furnishings. The only area we saw that was incomplete was the elevator area and some portions of the hallway. The rooms were nice and roomy with new, modern furnishings. Comfortable bed, flat screen TV, the works. The room images on the site look exactly like the rooms. If you are looking for a nice cozy hotel with a continental breakfast included this is a great choice. The hotel does not have a restaurant or other services so if you are looking for a hotel with full servcies, this would not be the place. Also the staff was helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at a W Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam1169
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, my husband and I really liked this Hotel! Comfy, Clean and Decorated like a W Hotel. I would stay again and bring my boys.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than other reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: ralb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under construction and I can see if you had stayed here prior to renovation it probably wasn't very nice. It's still incomplete, but we were given a newly renovated room that was very clean and very comfortable. The bed was comfortable with lovely bedding, and everything was new right down to the faucets. Our room looked exactly like the pictures. There was no construction noise and very little construction mess. Not wanting to spend a fortune on a hotel I wouldn't spend much time at and being a slight germaphobe, I was nervous to stay here after reading the reviews. However, I was very pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay here again. Food recommendation: Fremont Diner-a trailer on the side of the road that you'd never stop at but has fresh farm to table ingredients, Si Casa at the Oxbow Public Market for an amazing breakfast taco, Azzurro Pizza, and Norman Rose Cafe. Loved the food!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel, lousy night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: TallKelly
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel, so perhaps this was an unusual experience, but we had a horrible visit! They are in the process of remodeling, and they must have been behind schedule because they rented out rooms that were not yet complete. First, we arrived at 3:00 and had to wait until 4:00 for our room to be ready. Once inside the room, we discovered we did not have hand towels. I stepped outside the room and asked the maid for some and she said she'd have them delivered. Instead of waiting around, we went wine tasting and to dinner. When we returned five hours later, we had no towels. I wanted to call and request some, but we didn't have a phone. We also didn't have an alarm clock. The room felt a bit stuffy, so I went to adjust the air conditioner, but it didn't have any knobs on it. Frustrated, we went to bed, but the sheets were scratchy and my husband had trouble sleeping. I woke up every hour sweating because the room was so humid. It was a lousy night's sleep and we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. That's all I have to say... Stayed...”
Reviews.Author: jaydub80
Reviews.Content: Wow. That's all I have to say... Stayed here with 3 friends on a birthday weekend in Napa. napa was wonderful; this hotel was not. The pictures and ne made this place seem very nice but it was smelly and guests were complaining to thr front desk when we walked in. They upgraded us to a suite. We walked into the smelly and dusty room. The suite portion was an adjoining room that basically had a minibar, two chairs and a couch. It was smelly too. The beds were horrific. I can pretty much sleep anywhere and I was in pain in the morning because the beds were so bad. I would never recommend thus place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst place I have ever...”
Reviews.Author: Saelf
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed in. The pictures in the internet made it look better than what it is in person. It's beat down, looks and is dirty. My room was not thurally cleaned. I found hair in the sink and tub when first checking in, found a bottle cap underneath my blankets that didn't belong to me. The room has a bad smell, carpet and sheets are worn out. The tv stations had static. I thought it would be nice to dip or lay out by the pool, but after seeing the pool...i wouldnt dare go near it. My room was right next to the towns road, with no fence to block off our room from the outside. There is no fridge or microwave in the rooms. Motel 6 is probably better than this place. This place needs major upgrades and i wouldnt plan on staying here ever again.
